features: Note: 1)Too coarse a grind, too little coffee, or insufficiently tamping the grounds before brewing can all lead to inadequate pressure for a proper brew. 2)It is important to note that the amount of espresso extracted will vary depending on the grind size and amount and reprogramming may be needed when the size and amount are adjusted.Filter type:Paper
Sneak-a-Cup Feature - This feature temporarily stops the flow of coffee so you can pour your first cup before brewing ends without making a mess
Space-Saving Compact Design - Perfect for apartments, RVs, dorm rooms, and smaller coffee appetites

body.description: Delicious coffee, made easy! The BLACK+DECKER 5-Cup* Coffeemaker gets going with the flip of a switch, heating water to the optimal temperature for full flavor extraction. Coffee brews into the improved 5-Cup* Duralife glass carafe, which is engineered for comfortable handling and drip-free pouring. Plus, the permanent grounds filter removes the need for messy paper filters. Black+Decker and the Black+Decker logo are trademarks of The Black & Decker Corporation and are used under license. *Cup equals approximately 5 oz. (varies by brewing technique)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Delicious coffee, made easy! The BLACK+DECKER 5-Cup Serving Coffeemaker gets going with the flip of a switch, heating water to the optimal temperature for full flavor extraction. Coffee brews into the Duralife glass carafe, which is engineered for comfortable handling and drip-free pouring. Plus, the permanent grounds filter removes the need for messy paper filters.

Key Features Sneak-a-Cup Feature This feature temporarily stops the flow of coffee so you can pour your first cup before brewing ends without making a mess. Space-Saving Compact Design Perfect for apartments, RVs, dorm rooms, and smaller coffee appetites. Easy-Clean Removable Filter Basket The filter basket is dishwasher-safe for easy cleanup, and compatible with basket-style paper filters. Lighted On/Off Switch One-touch control for easy operation, and an on/off indicator light for peace of mind.

Easy-View Water Window The front-facing window shows you the exact amount of water that will turn into coffee. Optimal Brewing Temperature Water is heated to the perfect brewing temperature for ideal flavor results. Permanent Grounds Filter Included No need for paper filters. The permanent filter works with your favorite coffee grounds and it’s easy to clean. Keep Hot Carafe Plate The heated carafe plate keeps coffee at the ideal drinking temperature after brewing. Easy-View Water Window Optimal Brewing Temperature Permanent Grounds Filter Inclu Keep Hot Carafe Plate

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this 5 cup coffee pot because it was mid-range in price and a brand I'm familiar with: Black and Decker. I was looking at another popular brand but reviews had complained that the carafe was poorly designed so that every time they pour a cup of coffee it dribbles rather than having a clean pour. Some reviews mentioned that this was a much better designed pot. I find that to be true. I also love the sort of retro design of the coffee pot. Overall it works well - brews well, keeps it hot, and it comes with a permanent filter (a feature I was desiring). No complaints; I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: B&D has been around forever. This one is as well made as the one my parents used over 25 years ago.This model is a 5 cup brewer. Simple to use. Measure your coffee “correctly”…delicious brew quickly.It comes w a gold filter.It is space saving.Highly recommend. It works better than expensive models I’ve used.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes a delicious cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: I really love this little pot. It makes two nice cups of coffee, which is perfect for me in the morning. The brewed coffee comes out very hot and the warmer keeps it hot. I've had other pots where that is not the case. Its compact size is also perfect in that it does not take up much counter space. It's a little odd that the water reservoir is on the left side of the unit so you need to pour it in with your left hand. Guess it's giving us a taste of what it's like to be a south paw lol. The only negative is that you can't pull the coffee pot out before the brew cycle is done because there is no stopper, but that's not a big deal to me. I still give it five stars. Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works just fine. Easy to clean. Like the basket cover built into the lid
reviews.reviewText: Got a little tired of scratching my hand on sharp edges every time I tried to wipe out the small "Mr. C" pot. So when that maker died, I chose this slightly larger machine to replace it. Not disappointed. The pot handle has no sharp edges inside and the opening is slightly larger than the old maker, so cleaning and drying is a breeze. I like my coffee VERY strong, so I also appreciate the flip-down cover for the basket - it completely eliminates the "foam-over" problem I frequently encountered in the past. Finally, the brew temperature is just right for dark roast coffee and the hotplate is not too hot - the coffee easily keeps without degradation for up to about 20 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does the job for cheap
reviews.reviewText: Nothing to complain about this coffee maker. It's cheap, it works, it makes delicious coffee. A few notes from my first week:One or two reviews commented that the coffee wasn't hot enough. These people must have tongues of steel because I definitely need to let my drink cool down for about 5 minutes after pouring it or my mouth will get scorched.About the reusable basket. I agree that it should be cone shaped-style as opposed to the flat style, and it's strange to me that there's only mesh on the sides and not the bottom. It still gets the job done just fine though. And seriously people, it's too hard to clean? It takes approximately 30 seconds to clean out the mesh filter and pop in back into place. Save some paper!About the warped top. My parents have the old model of this coffee maker and that top definitely would warp when it was brewing. So far, I haven't noticed any warping on the lid of this model, and the plastic seems much heavier/stronger than the old model. I don't think it will warp, but will update if any issues arise.Finally, about the coffee strength. I do notice that this coffee seems a little weaker than my old coffee maker. I'm not sure if this is because a) the coffee grinds I'm using is different from my previous brand b) the mesh filter's flat style doesn't work as well as a conical style/paper filter or c) I just haven't found the sweet spot of grounds:water yet.Overall, if you read through all this, you're overthinking it! This is a solid $20 coffee maker and if you hate it get another one after a year or two.EDIT: Update, 11/26. As far as the coffee strength goes, the initial weak coffee taste I noticed was definitely from the grounds and not the maker. Since buying a better brand of grounds, my morning coffee comes out strong and hot!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simple and easy
reviews.reviewText: May not be expensive and lacks timers, etc., but does the job to brew small batches of coffee. Easy to fill the reservoir and load the coffee. Brewed coffee is sufficiently hot. Will take No. 2 coffee filters. Just wish the warmer plate could be adjusted so the coffee is not burned if left more than a few minutes. But still, so far, I recommend this model. It replaced a 4-cup Mr. Coffee coffeemaker.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Coffee Maker for Two!
reviews.reviewText: This is the perfect coffee maker for just two people. Easy to use, easy to clean, and great taste!EDITED TO ADD - Sadly, after only two months of use, the carafe broke without reason. I'd just finished a pot of coffee and put the carafe in an empty sink. After a minute or so, I heard something shatter and ran back to the kitchen to see what it was. The carafe busted along the top. Rather than replacing the carafe, I decided to upgrade to a completely different coffee maker.

My husband is elderly. He has some limitations on his right arm movement. Because the filter bucket is removeable and basically flat, he can place it on a small plate and insert the coffee filter and coffee. Then replace the filter bucket back into the coffee maker. The filter bucket is then at counter height instead of reaching up to the top of the coffee maker to insert coffee filter and coffee. The water tank has a larger opening on the left for easier pouring of water.

Honestly for an inexpensive coffee maker I'm very impressed. In my area we have very hard water and I've replaced too many other coffee machines. I figured this one was inexpensive so I wouldn't feel bad if it went. However, all of my expectations were completely surpassed. This is the longest lastly coffee maker that I've owned (previously owned kcup style coffee makers) so granted I wouldn't be able to directly compare to other drip coffee makers.This unit is easy to use and my favorite part is how simple it is to clean without having to buy expensive solutions or go through a daylong process. I always buy freshly roasted beans and grind them right before brewing and the results have been excellent. My other method is making pour overs and this brewer doesn't quite get to that standard but it makes up for it in ease of use.One other thing to mention is that a lot of people that own coffee makers with a heating plate complain about is leaving the coffee on the plate for a bit will give it a burnt taste. This is something I haven't experienced with this coffee maker. There were times where I've turned the machine on and forgot only to remember 20 minutes later and it didn't taste burnt at all so extra credit there.Lastly I'll touch on the sneak a cup feature. Basically there is a spring loaded stopper that gets pushed up by the pot to allow the fluid in. As I learned when you pull out the pot it'll drip a bit and ends up on the warming plate and can be messy. Also, you only have a very short time to do this so have a cup ready before sneaking or else the chamber will fill up and the stopper will not hold that pressure. I got lucky once in that exact situation and as it started to stream out I was able to replace the pot to minimize the mess but just be aware.Overall definitely worth the money!
I was looking for a coffee maker that is not bulky. Very happy with my purchase. It is very elegant.
For the money I wish it would of had a warmer.
